sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; const LaTeXInstallGuide = ({ onDismiss, onUseClientSidePDF }) => { return (

LaTeX Not Installed

To generate high-quality PDF resumes, ResuMate requires LaTeX (specifically pdflatex) to be installed on your system.

Benefits of Installing LaTeX
  • Professional typesetting quality comparable to top publishing systems
  • Perfect font rendering and spacing for impressive resumes
  • ATS-friendly output for better resume scanning results
  • Consistent formatting across all devices and printers
Installation Instructions:
{/* Windows Instructions */}

  1. Visit MiKTeX download page
  2. Download and run the installer
  3. Follow the installation wizard with default options
  4. Restart your computer after installation
  5. Return to ResuMate and try generating your resume again
{/* Mac Instructions */}

Using Homebrew:
  1. Open Terminal
  2. Run brew install --cask mactex-no-gui (smaller install) or brew install --cask mactex (full install)
  3. Wait for installation to complete
  4. Return to ResuMate and try generating your resume again
Manual Installation:
  1. Visit MacTeX download page
  2. Download and run the installer
  3. Follow the installation wizard
  4. Return to ResuMate and try generating your resume again
{/* Linux Instructions */}

Ubuntu/Debian:
  1. Open Terminal
  2. Run sudo apt-get update
  3. Run sudo apt-get install texlive-latex-base texlive-fonts-recommended texlive-fonts-extra texlive-latex-extra
  4. Return to ResuMate and try generating your resume again
Fedora/CentOS/RHEL:
  1. Open Terminal
  2. Run sudo dnf install texlive-scheme-medium
  3. Return to ResuMate and try generating your resume again
Alternatives:

If you prefer not to install LaTeX, you have these options:

  • Use our client-side PDF generator (quality may be lower)
  • Download the .tex file and compile it on another system with LaTeX
  • Use the .txt plain text version
Installation Status Check

After installing LaTeX, you can verify it was successful by:

  1. Closing and reopening ResuMate
  2. Generating your resume again
  3. If successful, you'll see the high-quality LaTeX PDF
); }; export default LaTeXInstallGuide;
